member.name: M:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.ISentNotificationDataRepository.EnsureSentNotificationDataTableExistsAsync
member.summary: This method ensures the SentNotificationData table is created in the storage. This method should be called before kicking off an Azure function that uses the SentNotificationData table. Otherwise the app will crash. By design, Azure functions (in this app) do not create a table if it's absent.
member.returns: A representing the result of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity
member.summary: Sent notification entity class. This entity holds all of the information about a recipient and the results for a notification having been sent to that recipient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.InitializationStatusCode
member.summary: This value is to be used when the entity is first initialized and stored and does not yet have a valid status code from a response for an attempt at sending the notification to the recipient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.FaultedAndRetryingStatusCode
member.summary: This value indicates that the Azure Function that attempted to process the queue message threw an exception. Because of this, this temporary status code is stored because the function will re-queue the queue message and try to process the queue message again. If the message fails to be processed enough times, then a different status code will be stored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.FinalFaultedStatusCode
member.summary: This value indicates that the Azure Function that attempted to process the queue message has failed to process the queue message enough times and thrown enough exceptions that the queue message will be placed on the dead letter queue. In this state, the queue message will not be attempted again. Because of this, this final faulted status code will be stored to indicate this final faulted state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.NotSupportedStatusCode
member.summary: This value indicates that operation is not supported by Azure Function and will not be processed further.

member.summary: String indicating the recipient type for the given notification was a user.

member.summary: String indicating the recipient type for the given notification was a team.

member.summary: String indicating success of sending the notification to the recipient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.RecipientNotFound
member.summary: String indicating a recipient is not found when sending the notification to the recipient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.Failed
member.summary: String indicating a failure response was received when sending the notification to the recipient.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.Throttled
member.summary: [Deprecated] String indicating sending the notification to the recipient was throttled and not sent successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.Retrying
member.summary: String indicating that processing the current queue message resulted in an exception so the message is being re-queued and attempted again. Because of this, this string will be stored in the repository as the delivery status until a more final state is reached.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.RecipientType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which type of recipient the notification was sent to using the recipient type strings at the top of this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.RecipientId
member.summary: Gets or sets the recipient's unique identifier. If the recipient is a user, this should be the AAD Id. If the recipient is a team, this should be the team Id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.TotalNumberOfSendThrottles
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of throttle responses the bot received when trying to send the notification to this recipient. Note: This does not include throttle responses received when creating the conversation. This total only represents throttle responses received when actually calling the send API. Note: This count may not include every throttled response the bot has ever received when attempting to send the notification to this recipient. If the queue message is added back to the queue to retry and the results of the attempt are not stored in the Sent Notification data table for that attempt, then those results are lost and are not stored here e.g. if the bot is put in a throttled state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.SentDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the DateTime the last recorded attempt at sending the notification to this recipient was completed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.IsStatusCodeFromCreateConversation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the status code is from the create conversation call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the last recorded response status code received by the bot when attempting to send the notification to this recipient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.AllSendStatusCodes
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma separated list representing all of the status code responses received when trying to send the notification to the recipient. These results can include success, failure, and throttle status codes. This list can also include a '-1' as a result if the function throws an overall exception when attempting to process the queue message. Note: This value may not include every status code response the bot has ever received when attempting to send the notification to this recipient. If the queue message is added back to the queue to retry and the results of the attempt are not stored in the Sent Notification data table for that attempt, then those results are lost and are not stored here e.g. if the bot is put in a throttled state (in that scenario all response codes that are missing should primarily be throttle responses).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.NumberOfFunctionAttemptsToSend
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times an Azure Function instance attempted to send the notification to the recipient and stored a final result. Note: This should only ever be one. If it is more than one, it is possible the recipient incorrectly received multiple, duplicate notifications - check AllSendStatusCodes. Note: If the function is triggered by a queue message but the processing is skipped, e.g. the system is in a throttled state or it is a duplicate message, then that is not counted as an attempt in this count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.DeliveryStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the summarized delivery status for the notification to this recipient using the status strings at the top of this class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the service URL for the recipient.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tenant id for the recipient.

member.summary: Gets or sets the user type for the recipient.

member.summary: Gets or sets the user id for the recipient.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Teams.Apps.CompanyCommunicator.Common.Repositories.SentNotificationData.SentNotificationDataEntity.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message for the last recorded error the bot encountered when attempting to process the queue message. If a request is retried and eventually is successful, this field will still be filled with data about the last error encountered. Note: This is a record for the last error encountered. If multiple errors are encountered when attempting to process the queue message only the final one will be stored here.
